channel.title: San Bernardino on The Encryption Compendium
channel.description: Recent content in San Bernardino on The Encryption Compendium

item.title: Encryption and the Press Clause
item.description: Authors: Baranetsky, D Victoria Published: 2017 Tags: 2010s Amendment I Apple Crypto Wars Crypto Wars I Crypto Wars II Journalism San Bernardino Abstract: Almost twenty years ago, a hostile debate over whether government could regulate encryption—later named the Crypto Wars—seized the country. At the center of this debate stirred one simple question: is encryption protected speech? This issue touched all branches of government percolating from Congress, to the President, and eventually to the federal courts.

item.title: U.S. Says It Has Unlocked iPhone Without Apple
item.description: Authors: Benner, Katie and Lichtblau, Eric Published: March 2016 URL: https://www.nytimes.com/2016/03/29/technology/apple-iphone-fbi-justice-department-case.html Tags: 2010s Apple San Bernardino iPhone Abstract: The Justice Department announcement, in a court filing, ends an immediate legal battle over the San Bernardino shooting case but raises questions about Apple’s security.
